wikipedia_page.main: Gilbert Walter King OBE (30 June 1871 – 23 December 1937) was a British judge who served in China.  His last position before retirement was as Assistant Judge of the British Supreme Court for China.

link_mentions.page: List of people associated with the University of London
response: * Gilbert Walter King – Judge of the British Supreme Court for China

link_mentions.page: Brighton Hove & Sussex Sixth Form College
response: * Gilbert Walter King OBE, judge of the British Supreme Court for China
* Gilbert Walter King (1871–1937), British judge who served in China
* Gilbert Walter King, registrar and then judge of the British Supreme Court for China

In 1927, he was promoted to Chief Judge of the British Supreme Court for China on the retirement of Sir Skinner TurnerObituary, The Times, May 7, 1947 and was knighted in February 1928.London Gazette, 24 February 1928, p1291  Gilbert Walter King succeeded him as Assistant Judge.  He continued to serve a judge in Weihaiwei until the territory was returned Chinese rule on 1 October 1930.

In November 1931, he was appointed Judge of the British Supreme Court for China based in Shanghai replacing Gilbert Walter King.North China Herald, November 17, 1931, p243  Grant Jones served as Acting Chief Judge of the court in 1933 and 1937.Foreign Office List 1943, p 232
